e4: Adopting a no-bias policy enhances transparency and credibility with stakeholders, aligning ABC company with ethical standards and mitigating risks involved with misleading yet tolerated reporting practices. Despite initial investor adjustments, over time the shift to unbiased reporting fosters long-term trust and stability by clearly communicating genuine financial health to all investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should embody honesty, transparency, and accuracy, allowing investors to make informed decisions. It should avoid any form of deception or manipulation of financial information. Additional considerations include consistency in reporting for comparisons over time, clear communication around any policy changes, and sensitivity to all investor groups ensuring equal access to accurate data, promoting fairness across the market.
e6: How does management plan to communicate the change in reporting policy to ensure investors understand accurate EPS figures? What strategies will be used to support retail investors who may not quickly notice the revised approach? How does the team assess the risk of potential legal consequences compared to market reaction risks?
